A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Rian Johnson will go down in history for having utterly trashed Luke Skywalker who acts like a whiny brat who doesn't want to get out of bed to go to school for most of the film. Thrown in a scene of him sucking milk (or something else) out of a space cow's teat and there you have it\, the complete flushing of a beloved character down the toilet. I now understand why Mark Hamill didn't agree with Johnson in the (lame) direction he wanted to take the iconic character. Somebody needed a payday though. Compare the Writers between The Force Awakens and this debacle and you'll quickly realize the talent was sadly missing. For Disney to so arbitrarily piss on such a legendary character is disgraceful and I'm officially done watching anymore new Star Wars movies. This film has soooooo many problems (Laura Dern looking like a Eurotrash raver\, lame virtue-signaling political messages\, utter disrespect for established characters in the series\, etc.) that I could go on forever. \nBut I'll leave by saying Goodbye Star Wars\, you've grown unfortunately vile and soulless...and it's really heartbreaking.\n     -T. Stickle
